_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Empyrion - Galactic Survival
author: schattenwolf2008@schattenwolf2008.net
startup:
/bin/bash -lc 'export HOME="/home/container"; \
export USE_PANEL_CONFIG="{{USE_PANEL_CONFIG}}"; \
export SRV_PORT="{{server.build.default.port}}"; \
export SERVER_NAME="{{SERVER_NAME}}"; \
export SRV_PASSWORD="{{SRV_PASSWORD}}"; \
export MAX_PLAYERS="{{MAX_PLAYERS}}"; \
export SRV_RESERVE_PLAYFIELDS="{{SRV_RESERVE_PLAYFIELDS}}"; \
export SRV_DESCRIPTION="{{SRV_DESCRIPTION}}"; \
export SRV_PUBLIC="{{SRV_PUBLIC}}"; \
export SRV_STOP_PERIOD="{{SRV_STOP_PERIOD}}"; \
export TELNET_ENABLED="{{TELNET_ENABLED}}"; \
export TELNET_PORT="{{TELNET_PORT}}"; \
export TELNET_PASSWORD="{{TELNET_PASSWORD}}"; \
export EAC_ACTIVE="{{EAC_ACTIVE}}"; \
export MAX_ALLOWED_SIZE_CLASS="{{MAX_ALLOWED_SIZE_CLASS}}"; \
export ALLOWED_BLUEPRINTS="{{ALLOWED_BLUEPRINTS}}"; \
export HEARTBEAT_SERVER="{{HEARTBEAT_SERVER}}"; \
export HEARTBEAT_CLIENT="{{HEARTBEAT_CLIENT}}"; \
export LOG_FLAGS="{{LOG_FLAGS}}"; \
export DISABLE_FAMILY_SHARING="{{DISABLE_FAMILY_SHARING}}"; \
export KICK_PLAYER_WITH_PING="{{KICK_PLAYER_WITH_PING}}"; \
export TIMEOUT_BOOTING_PF="{{TIMEOUT_BOOTING_PF}}"; \
export PLAYER_LOGIN_PARALLEL_COUNT="{{PLAYER_LOGIN_PARALLEL_COUNT}}"; \
export PLAYER_LOGIN_VIP_NAMES="{{PLAYER_LOGIN_VIP_NAMES}}"; \
export ENABLE_DLC="{{ENABLE_DLC}}"; \
export GAME_NAME="{{GAME_NAME}}"; \
export GAME_MODE="{{GAME_MODE}}"; \
export WORLD_SEED="{{WORLD_SEED}}"; \
export SCENARIO_NAME="{{SCENARIO_NAME}}"; \
export SCENARIO_WORKSHOP_ID="{{SCENARIO_WORKSHOP_ID}}"; \
export STEAM_LOGIN="{{STEAM_LOGIN}}"; \
export STEAM_USERNAME="{{STEAM_USERNAME}}"; \
export STEAM_PASSWORD="{{STEAM_PASSWORD}}"; \
if [ "{{BETA}}" = "1" ]; then export BETA=1; else unset BETA; fi; \
exec /entrypoint.sh'

installation.script:
#!/bin/ash
set -e

BASE_DIR="/mnt/server/Steam/steamapps/common/Empyrion - Dedicated Server"
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR"

cat > "$BASE_DIR/dedicated.yaml" <<'YAML'
### Dedicated server settings
### To use your own dedicated.yaml (e.g., "MyDedicatedConfig.yaml"), add "-dedicated MyDedicatedConfig.yaml" to the corresponding batch file

ServerConfig:
    Srv_Port: 30000
    Srv_Name: My Server
    Srv_Password:                      # Only use with public servers (not for Local Coop)
    Srv_MaxPlayers: 8

    # Idle playfield servers held in reserve. For busy public servers, we recommend at least 2 (default = 1)
    # Valid range: 0..10
    Srv_ReservePlayfields: 1

    ### Server description shown in Server Browser
    ### max 127 chars: "-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"
    Srv_Description: "Server info, can contain [b]bold[/b] text or a [u][url=empyriongame.com]link[/url][/u]."

    ### Set the following parameter to false (or comment the line out) if you want to hide your server in the Server Browser 
    ### If server is not visible you can connect via IP or via joining a friend's game.
    Srv_Public: true
    
    ### All playfield servers will be automatically stopped every <n> real time hours. Players will get some warning messages before
    Srv_StopPeriod: 

    ### Activate Telnet server
    Tel_Enabled: false
    Tel_Port: 30004
    Tel_Pwd: 

    ### Activate Easy Anti Cheat (clients have to enable EAC via Options -> Misc to connect to a EAC protected server)
    EACActive: true

    ### Location of save game folder    
    # SaveDirectory: Saves

    ### Restrict allowed Blueprint size class: restricted types are not allowed to be produced or spawned
    # 1 = allow only small blueprints, ... , 10 = allow very large blueprints, ..., 50 = allow gigantic blueprints, ... , 0 = no limits
    ### Warning: large blueprints can have very strong performance impact!
    MaxAllowedSizeClass: 10

    ### Restrict Blueprint types allowed for production in factory
    ### None      = Blueprint system completely disabled
    ### StockOnly = only stock blueprints can be produced
    ### All       = all types allowed (default)
    AllowedBlueprints: All

    ### Timeout in seconds after which a playfield server process will be killed (and all players on it disconnected) if it does no longer send heartbeat messages to the dedi 
    ### Set 0 to disable this feature
    HeartbeatServer: 15

    ### Timeout in seconds after which a client will be disconnected if it does no longer send heartbeat messages to the dedi
    ### Set 0 to disable this feature
    HeartbeatClient: 30

    ### Enable extra log outputs (for debugging purposes)
    ### Defined flags: (add together the values if more than one group should be active at the same time)
    ### 0 = no extra logs
    ### 1 = EAC
    ### 2 = EAC_all_details (includes EAC - Note: this generates a lot of log lines)
    LogFlags: 0

    ### Uncomment the following line if you want to prohibit Steam Family Sharers playing (only the game owner can then play)
    DisableSteamFamilySharing: True

    ### Players with a ping higher than the value specified below will be locked out of the game. We recommend to not allow too high pings as this can result in player cheating
    KickPlayerWithPing: 300

    ### Monitors booting playfield server processes, kills them if they time out (time in seconds, 0 = disabled)
    ### Note: This is a conservative default, for faster servers 60 seconds should be ok
    TimeoutBootingPfServer: 90
    
    ### If specified, the number of parallel logins to a server are restricted to this number. This is important when you expect a big number of people to login at the same time
    PlayerLoginParallelCount: 5
    ### Add steam ids for preferred players that will get a better position in the login queue " and comma seperated, e.g. "123456789,123456788,123456787"
    PlayerLoginVipNames: ""

    ### Enable if hosted scenario should use DLC features - NOTE: all players that want to join the server need to own the DLC
    EnableDLC: false


GameConfig:
    GameName: DediGame                       # Determines name of the save game 
    Mode: Survival                           # Survival or Creative
    Seed:                                    # The seed determines how the world is procedurally generated - the same seed means the same world
    CustomScenario: Default Multiplayer      # Enable custom scenario. Name of custom scenario from folder Content\Scenarios

    # SharedData transfer via cloud storage
    # Since the in-game transfer is slow and costs a lot of dedi server bandwidth, you can now use a cloud storage service.
    #
    # How to use:
    # - zip the complete SharedData folder of the hosted scenario and upload the zip file to a cloud service
    #   - side note: the name of the zip file doesn't matter, you can use the scenario name or add date or version info if you like
    # - ! enable sharing for the uploaded file so that everyone with a sharing link can download it !
    # - create the sharing link for the zip file and set it below as SharedDataURL parameter
    #   - Note: when that parameter exists, the old in-game transfer is disabled
    #
    # Notes:
    # - usually the link URL from the cloud service is a "view URL" => when you paste it into your browser a page opens with a Download button somewhere
    # - since we need to directly download the file, we internally convert the "view URL" into a "download URL"
    # - this currently works for "Google Drive", "OneDrive" (Personal variant) and DropBox
    # - if you want to use another service, you need to get a "download URL" yourself
    #   - also set that as SharedDataURL parameter but prefix it with an underscore '_' to mark it as such

    # !!! Please DON'T FORGET to update the URL when you upload a new version of your zip file !!!

    # Google Drive example
    # SharedDataURL: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xxxxxxxxxxK/view?usp=sharing

    # Example for a "download URL" - notice the leading underscore character
    # SharedDataURL: _https://anotherservice.com/abc123
YAML

echo "Default dedicated.yaml created at: $BASE_DIR/dedicated.yaml"

variables.name: Beta?
variables.description:
Will add a flag to the starting options to enable beta. (This has not been tested; Beta may be enabled.)

IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO CHANGE THIS AFTER INITIAL SERVER CREATION.

variables.name: Scenario Workshop ID
variables.description:
/!\ DOWNLOADING FROM WORKSHOP DOES NOT WORK WITHOUT LOGGING IN TO STEAMCMD. IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO CONNECT YOUR PERSONAL STEAM ACCOUNT TO THE STEAMCMD SERVER, AS LOGIN CREDENTIAL IS STORED IN PLAIN TEXT. 

You can however still log in if you create a seperate steam account for the server. You can give access to games / workshop through family sharing, or buying the game on that account. Please keep in mind, that for free games, you will have to log in with Steam and add them to the library.

To avoid to login, you can also download the Scenario from your normal Steam Workshop. Then open the game files (e.g. D:/Programs/Steam/steamapps/) and navigate to workshop/content/383120/, (383120 is the game number for Empyrion) find the last created directory and upload that onto the server. Then rename the folder to the scenario name.

YOU WILL HAVE TO SET THIS NAME IN SCENARIO NAME FOR THE SERVER TO USE IT. IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO CHANGE THIS AFTER INITIAL SERVER CREATION.

This will add a workshop id to a file to tell SteamCMD to download it on the next boot.
You can find the workshop ID of a Scenario when viewing the URL.
Example for Reforged Eden 2 Beta:
URL: https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=3143225812
ID: 3143225812

When starting up, it will download the provided workshop object and automaticly copy it over into the Server's Scenarios folder if not already there.
To immediatly activate it, copy and paste the Scenario Workshop ID from this field into the Scenario Name field.
NOT THE SCENARIO NAME FROM THE WORKSHOP (e.g. Reforged Eden 2 Beta), BUT THE WORKSHOP ID.
If that still does not work, you may try to manually copy the scenario over.

Go to: /home/container/Steam/steamapps/workshop/content/
Look for the Workshop ID that you provided here. Then enter that folder.
Now move the containing folder to /home/container/Steam/steamapps/common/Empyrion - Dedicated Server/Content/Scenarios/

You can click on move and use this:

../../../common/Empyrion - Dedicated Server/Content/Scenarios/SCENARIONAME

Make sure to replace SCENARIONAME with the name of the Scenario downloaded. You will need to provide that name exactly to the Scenario Name setting in order for the server to be able to find and load it.

variables.name: Scenario Name
variables.description:
Enable custom scenario. Name of custom scenario from folder

/home/container/Steam/steamapps/common/Empyrion - Dedicated Server/Content/Scenarios

IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO CHANGE THIS AFTER INITIAL SERVER CREATION.

Also: If you used the Workshop ID to download the Scenario, simply copy and paste the Workshop Scenario ID into this field and the server will use it.
DO NOT TYPE THE SCENARIO NAME, E.G. REFORGED EDEN 2 BETA, UNLESS YOU RENAMED THE FOLDER IN THE SCENARIOS DIRECTORY.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description:
Server name shown in the server browser.
Limit: max 60 characters (longer names are truncated).
Allowed: letters (A–Z, a–z), numbers (0–9), spaces, and most punctuation (#, _, -, |, [ ]).
Avoid: quotes (" or '); avoid tabs (use spaces only).
Formatting:
 Bold: [b]Bold Text[/b]
 Underline: [u]Underlined[/u]
 URL: [url=http://example.com]Clickable Text[/url]
 Color: [color=red]Red Text[/color] or [color=#ff8800]Orange[/color]
You can combine styles:
 Example: [b][color=gold]★ My Awesome Server ★[/color][/b]

variables.name: Slots
variables.description:
The maximum amount of how many players can be on the server. Adapt this number depending on your server's ressources.

A rough list (this is from ChatGPT, I have no clue about it.)

4 players  →  4 GB RAM
8 players  →  6 GB RAM
16 players →  8 GB RAM
32 players →  12 GB RAM
50 players →  16 GB RAM
64 players →  20 GB RAM
100 players →  28 GB RAM

Please keep in mind that the server performance heavily depends on the used CPU. A CPU with atleast 3.5 GHz is recommended, look for more details online.

variables.name: Telnet Port
variables.description:
Port used for remote server management via Telnet
/!\ CAREFUL! SET A PASSWORD BEFORE EXPOSING THE PORT TO ANY NETWORK. SETTING THIS TO THE SERVER PORT (not sure if that works) WILL AUTOMATICLY EXPOSE IT. SET A PASSWORD!. (Unless you only use it within the container then no need.)

variables.name: Enable Telnet?
variables.description:
Telnet is used for remote server management. Enabling this will also enable the ability to use console commands in the pterodactyl console panel.

/!\ Careful! SET A SECURE PASSWORD BEFORE ENABLING / OPENING THE PORT TO ANY NETWORK

variables.name: Telnet Password
variables.description: Password required for Telnet access. PLEASE DO NOT LEAVE THIS EMPTY TO PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS.

variables.name: Public Server? (Show in Serverlist?)
variables.description:
Set the following parameter to false (or comment the line out) if you want to hide your server in the Server Browser.
If server is not visible you can connect via IP or via joining a friend's game.

variables.name: Easy Anti Cheat (EAC)
variables.description:
Activate Easy Anti Cheat (clients have to enable EAC via Options -> Misc to connect to a EAC protected server).

Easy Anti Cheat is a client-side anti-cheat system that watches out for game manipulation from the client's side, which makes using hackclients nearly impossible.

variables.name: Max allowed size class
variables.description:
Restrict allowed Blueprint size class: restricted types are not allowed to be produced or spawned
1 = allow only small blueprints, ... , 10 = allow very large blueprints, ..., 50 = allow gigantic blueprints, ... , 0 = no limits

Warning: large blueprints can have very strong performance impact!

variables.name: Allowed Blueprints
variables.description:
Restrict Blueprint types allowed for production in factory
None = Blueprint system completely disabled
StockOnly = only stock blueprints can be produced
All = all types allowed (default)

variables.name: Heartbeat Server
variables.description:
Timeout in seconds after which a playfield server process will be killed (and all players on it disconnected) if it does no longer send heartbeat messages to the dedi
Set 0 to disable this feature

variables.name: Timeout Booting PF
variables.description:
Monitors booting playfield server processes, kills them if they time out (time in seconds, 0 = disabled)
Note: This is a conservative default, for faster servers 60 seconds should be ok

variables.name: Game (Save) Name
variables.description:
Determines name of the save game.
/!\ CAREFUL! I DO NOT RECOMMEND TO CHANGE THIS AFTER INITIAL SERVER START. YOU WILL MOST LIKELY JUST CREATE A NEW WORLD, BUT I DO NOT KNOW IF THAT CAUSES ANY ISSUES.

variables.name: Game Mode
variables.description:
If the server is Survival or Creative. In Creative mode, players can access an unlimited inventory with all items (by default using "H". This is optimal for building or testing servers, but most people prefer to play on Survival servers. (As an Admin it will still be possible to access items or other tools using console commands like im (itemmenu), gm (godmode); gm invisible (godmode invisible; gives you full access to all structures). Also, can be changed later or in game.

/!\ May need to adjust scenario after change.

variables.name: Generator Seed
variables.description:
Seed used to randomize generation of playfields, galaxies etc. /!\ DO NOT CHANGE AFTER INITIAL SERVER CREATION, OR DELETE THE WORLD AFTERWARDS TO AVOID WORLD CORRUPTION.

Leave empty to auto-generate

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description:
Only use with public servers (not for Local Coop).

Setting a password here will make players require to enter it in order to join the server.

/!\ DO NOT USE QOUTES SUCH AS " or ' AS IT CAN MESS UP THE CONFIG.

variables.name: Server Reserve Playfields
variables.description:
Idle playfield servers held in reserve. For busy public servers, we recommend at least 2 (default = 1)
Valid range: 0..10

variables.name: Server Description
variables.description:
Server description shown in Server Browser
Max 127 chars: "-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"
Example: "Server info, can contain [b]bold[/b] text or a [u][url=empyriongame.com]link[/url][/u]."

/!\ DO NOT USE QOUTES SUCH AS " OR '. Such change will mess up the configuration.
variables.default_value: Server info, can contain [b]bold[/b] text or a [u][url=empyriongame.com]link[/url][/u].

variables.name: Server Stop Period
variables.description: After how many hours the server should automaticly shut down.

variables.name: Heartbeat Client
variables.description:
Timeout in seconds after which a client will be disconnected if it does no longer send heartbeat messages to the dedi
Set 0 to disable this feature

variables.name: Log Flags
variables.description:
Enable extra log outputs (for debugging purposes)
Defined flags: (add together the values if more than one group should be active at the same time)
0 = no extra logs
1 = EAC
2 = EAC_all_details (includes EAC - Note: this generates a lot of log lines)

variables.name: Disable Family Sharing Join
variables.description: Set to true if you want to prohibit Steam Family Sharers playing (only the game owner can then play)

variables.name: Kick player with ping
variables.description: Players with a ping higher than the value specified below will be locked out of the game. We recommend to not allow too high pings as this can result in player cheating

variables.name: Player Login Parallel Count
variables.description: If specified, the number of parallel logins to a server are restricted to this number. This is important when you expect a big number of people to login at the same time

variables.name: Player Login VIP Names
variables.description: Add steam ids for preferred players that will get a better position in the login queue

variables.name: Enable DLC?
variables.description: Enable if hosted scenario should use DLC features - NOTE: all players that want to join the server need to own the DLC

variables.name: Use Panel Config
variables.description:
Enable to use the generated dedicated-generated.yaml instead of the default dedicated.yaml. If set to 1, the server will start with the generated configuration file based on your panel settings. Can be found in Startup section.

Notes: If you want to make your changes manually, you have to disable this option and use the default empyrion config file dedicated.yaml.
You cannot directly write to the dedicated generated yaml file, it will be overwritten. Instead, you can disable this option, make changes using the settings normally, and copy and paste them into the dedicated.yaml file.

variables.name: Use Steam Account for SteamCMD Login?
variables.description:
0 = Use anonymous SteamCMD without login
1 = Use Steam account for SteamCMD login
Required for some game servers to download or update; required to download workshop content on some games.

/!\ Make sure to have set the username and password for the Steam account. Watch out for Steam Guard verification during startup.

/!\ WARNING AND NOTES!
IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO CONNECT YOUR STEAM ACCOUNT TO THE STEAMCMD SERVER, AS LOGIN CREDENTIAL IS STORED IN PLAIN TEXT. 
You can however still log in if you create a seperate steam account for the server.

You can give access to games / workshop through family sharing, or buying the game on that account. Please keep in mind, that for free games, you will have to log in with Steam and add them to the library.

Scenario downloads: To avoid to login, you can download the Scenario from your normal Steam Workshop. Then open the game files (e.g. D:/Programs/Steam/steamapps/) and navigate to workshop/content/383120/, (383120 is the game number for Empyrion) find the last created directory and upload that onto the server. Then rename the folder to the scenario name.

variables.name: Steam Username
variables.description:
Steam account username. 

/!\ CAREFUL: Do not use your personal Steam account - credentials are stored in plain text. 
Use a secondary account.

variables.name: Steam Password
variables.description:
Steam account password. 

/!\ CAREFUL: Do not use your personal Steam account - credentials are stored in plain text. 
Use a secondary account.
/!\ AVOID THE USE OF QOUTES SUCH AS " OR ', AS THOSE CAN MESS WITH CONFIGURATION FILES
